com.gaurav.tree
Class BinarySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
  com.gaurav.tree.ArrayTree<E>
      com.gaurav.tree.BinarySearchTree<E>
Type Parameters:
E -
All Implemented Interfaces:
NumberedTree<E>, Tree<E>, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>
public class BinarySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends ArrayTree<E>
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This is a BST implementation and requires its nodes to implement Comparable.

Also add(E, E) and add(E, E, int) throw UnsupportedOperationException because this implementation requires identification of parents on its own. Thus, only add(E) works. The parent is figured out automatically based on BST rules. The first node always becomes the root

Author:
Gaurav Saxena

add

public boolean add(E parent,
                   E child)
            throws NodeNotFoundException
Description copied from class: ArrayTree
Adds child at the first available slot in the children array. If none of the slots are available it throws exception

Specified by:
add in interface Tree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
Overrides:
add in class ArrayTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
Parameters:
parent - object to which child object needs to be added. Parent is allowed to be null only when there are no other nodes present in the tree. In that case, the child will be added as root
child - object
Returns:
true if parent was found and child is not already in the tree, otherwise false
Throws:
NodeNotFoundException - if parent is not found
See Also:
Tree.add(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

add

public boolean add(E parent,
                   E child,
                   int index)
            throws NodeNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: NumberedTree
Adds a child to a parent at a particular index If another object is present at child index then that is replaced with the new one

Specified by:
add in interface NumberedTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
Overrides:
add in class ArrayTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
Parameters:
parent - object to which child object needs to be added. Parent is allowed to be null only when there are no other nodes present in the tree. In that case, the child will be added as root
child - object
index - index at which child needs to be added. It should be between 0 and k-1, k being the maximum number of children allowed
Returns:
true if parent was found and child is not already in the tree, otherwise false
Throws:
NodeNotFoundException
